ygData.subject: Re: Definition of Evolution
ygData.msgSnippet: I guess I ll throw my 2 cents into this discussion.  As Mitchell pointed out, no one is really right or wrong when it comes to definitions.  Nevertheless, I

Subject: Re: Definition of Evolution

I guess I'll throw my 2 cents into this discussion.  As Mitchell
pointed out, no one is really right or wrong when it comes to
definitions.  Nevertheless, I prefer to use terminology in a way that
is intuitive and simple, and I feel that Derek's definition of
evolution, though arguably technically sound, does not fit my
intuitions and is therefore potentially misleading.  (Misleading
because only someone who knew Derek and his reasoning would be able to
appreciate his assumptions.)  The problem I have is that evolution to
me includes the central notion of "survival of the fittest," and
Derek's "evolution with pure drift" has no notion of fitness at all,
making it quite in contrast to my intuitions.  Of course, there is no
right answer, but when I think of evolution, I think of competition.

ken
